title: 106_s3
content:
The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" includes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. This amendment does not affect tax rates for the purposes of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $43,050: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $43,050 but not over $104,050: $5,811.75 plus 25.2% of the excess over $43,050
- Over $104,050 but not over $158,550: $21,183.75 plus 27.9% of the excess over $104,050
- Over $158,550 but not over $283,150: $36,389.25 plus 32.4% of the excess over $158,550
- Over $283,150: $76,759.65 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. Heads of Households are subject to these tax rates. For heads of households, the tax rates are as follows:
- Not over $43,050: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $43,050 but not over $104,050: $5,811.75 plus 25.2% of the excess
- Over $104,050 but not over $158,550: $21,183.75 plus 27.9% of the excess
- Over $158,550 but not over $283,150: $36,389.25 plus 32.4% of the excess
- Over $283,150: $76,759.65 plus 35.64% of the excess. For unmarried individuals, the tax rates are as follows:
- Not over $34,550: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $34,550 but not over $89,150: $4,664.25 plus 25.2% of the excess
- Over $89,150 but not over $144,400: $18,423.45 plus 27.9% of the excess
- Over $144,400 but not over $283,150: $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of the excess
- Over $283,150: $78,793.20 plus 35.64% of the excess. For unmarried individuals (excluding surviving spouses and heads of households), the tax rates are as follows: $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of the excess over $144,400, and for income over $283,150, it is $78,793.20 plus 35.64% of the excess. For taxable income over $25,750 but not over $62,450, the tax is $3,476.25 plus 25.2% of the excess. For income over $62,450 but not over $130,250, the tax is $12,724.65 plus 27.9% of the excess. For income over $130,250 but not over $283,150, the tax is $31,640.85 plus 32.4% of the excess. For income over $283,150, the tax is $81,180.45 plus 35.64% of the excess. Married individuals filing separate returns have different tax brackets. For married individuals filing separate returns, the tax is $81,180.45 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. The tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $21,525: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $21,525 but not over $52,025: $2,905.87, plus 25.2% of the excess over $21,525
- Over $52,025 but not over $79,275: $10,591.87, plus 27.9% of the excess over $52,025
- Over $79,275 but not over $141,575: $18,194.62, plus 32.4% of the excess over $79,275
- Over $141,575: $38,379.82, plus 35.64% of the excess over $141,575. The tax rates for estates and trusts are as follows: Over $141,575, $38,379.82 plus 35.64% of the excess. The tax rates for taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $1,750: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $1,750 but not over $4,050: $236.25 plus 25.2% of the excess
- Over $4,050 but not over $6,200: $815.85 plus 27.9% of the excess
- Over $6,200 but not over $8,450: $1,415.70 plus 32.4% of the excess
- Over $8,450: $2,144.70 plus 35.64% of the excess The tax rates for taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $1,750: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $1,750 but not over $4,050: $236.25 plus 25.2% of the excess
- Over $4,050 but not over $6,200: $815.85 plus 27.9% of the excess
- Over $6,200 but not over $8,450: $1,415.70 plus 32.4% of the excess
- Over $8,450: $2,144.70 plus 35.64% of the excess

Inflation Adjustment Conforming Amendments have been made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, updating various sections to reflect changes in years from 1992 to 1998. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been updated to reflect changes from 1992 to 1998 by amending various sections. This includes striking paragraph (7) and amending provisions in sections such as 25A, 32, 41, 59, 63, 68, 135, 151, 220, 221, 512, 513, 685, 877, 911, 2032A, and 2503. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been updated to reflect changes from 1992 to 1998 by amending various sections, including sections 221(g)(1)(B), 512(d)(2)(B), 513(h)(2)(C)(ii), 685(c)(3)(B), 877(a)(2), 911(b)(2)(D)(ii)(II), 2032A(a)(3)(B), 2503(b)(2)(B), 2631(c)(1)(B), 4001(e)(1)(B), 4261(e)(4)(A)(ii), 6039F(d), 6323(i)(4)(B), 6601(j)(3)(B), and 7430(c)(1). Amendments were made to section 42(h)(6)(G)(i) and section 132(f)(6) of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been updated with amendments to various sections, including changes from 1992 to 1998. Amendments were made to sections 6601(j)(3)(B) and 7430(c)(1), as well as section 42(h)(6)(G)(i) and section 132(f)(6) of the Code. Additionally, there were conforming amendments to sections 1(g)(7)(B)(ii)(II) and 1(h) of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to change tax percentages in various sections. For example, the amendment includes reducing the percentage from 15% to 13.5% in certain sections, such as 1(h) and 3402(p)(2) of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to change tax percentages in various sections, reducing percentages in sections such as 3402(p)(1)(B), 3402(p)(2), 3402(q)(1), 3402(r)(3), and 3406(a)(1) from 15%, 28%, and 31% to 13.5%, 25.2%, and 27.9% respectively. These amendments will apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998. Section 3406(a)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to change the tax percentage from "31 percent" to "27.9 percent." These amendments will apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998.
